SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.swfm.mica
Class MiViewport

java.lang.Object
  com.swfm.mica.MiViewport
public class MiViewport
extends java.lang.Object

This class manages the world (or model) and device (or output) spaces associated with an editor. This includes managing their bounds as well as the transformations between them and any contraints on their sizes. Device Space: The device may be the actual screen (or a printer) or another viewport's world space. World Space: The world may be the mapped directly to device space or may be scaled to the desired semantic units. Universe Space: The bounds within which the world space is contrained. Miniverse Space: The size which the world space mus be larger than.

Version:
%I% %G%
Author:
Michael L. Davis

confineProposedWorldToConstraints

public void confineProposedWorldToConstraints(MiBounds proposed)
Shrinks, if necessary, and translates this viewport if necessary to keep the world coordinates within the specified (if any) universe (maximum world space) and miniverse (minimum world space).

Parameters:
proposed - the proposed bounds that are modified, no change is made to this viewport.

confineWorldToMiniverse

public void confineWorldToMiniverse(MiBounds proposed)
Modifies proposed bounds, if necessary to assure that it is larger than the miniverse.

Parameters:
proposed - the proposed bounds that are modified, no change is made to this viewport.

confineWorldToUniverse

public void confineWorldToUniverse(MiBounds proposed)
Modifies proposed bounds, if necessary to assure that it fits within the universe.

Parameters:
proposed - the proposed bounds that are modified, no change is made to this viewport.

getHorizontalPositionOfWorldInUniverse

public double getHorizontalPositionOfWorldInUniverse()
Returns the horizontal location of the center of the world space within the maximum allowed size of the world space, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0. This is usually used to reposition a scrollbar in response to a change in the world space.

Returns:
the normalized horizontal position

getHorizontalSizeOfWorldInUniverse

public double getHorizontalSizeOfWorldInUniverse()
Returns the relative size, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0, of the current world space relative to the maximum allowed world space. This is usually used to determine what the size of a scrollbar should be.

Returns:
the normalized horizontal size

getVerticalPositionOfWorldInUniverse

public double getVerticalPositionOfWorldInUniverse()
Returns the vertical location of the center of the world space within the maximum allowed size of the world space, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0. This is usually used to reposition a scrollBar in response to a change in the world space.

Returns:
the normalized vertical position

getVerticalSizeOfWorldInUniverse

public double getVerticalSizeOfWorldInUniverse()
Returns the relative size, on a scale from 0.0 to 1.0, of the current world space relative to the maximum allowed world space. This is usually used to determine what the size of a scrollbar should be.

Returns:
the normalized vertical size

confineTranslatedExtremaToUniverse

public boolean confineTranslatedExtremaToUniverse(MiVector tVector,
                                                  MiBounds bounds)
Modifies the given translation, if necessary, to keep the given bounds within the universe. This is used by the system to assure translated objects stay within the maximum allowed bounds of world space.

Parameters:
tVector - the proposed (and returned) translation
bounds - the bounds to confine
Returns:
true if tVector was modified

getAmountExtremaTranslatedOutsideWorld

public void getAmountExtremaTranslatedOutsideWorld(MiVector tVector,
                                                   MiBounds bounds,
                                                   MiVector panVector)
Calculates how far the given bounds will be translated outside the world space if the given translation is applied. This returns, in panVector, how much the world space would have to be translated in order for the object to remain visible. This is used in order to support autopan functionality.

Parameters:
tVector - the translation of the bounds
bounds - the bounds before translation
panVector - returned with how far bounds will be translated oustide world space

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Prints information about this transform.
